results.title: Blackberry subway jam
results.creator_credit: Robert Doucet, Eunice Macaulay, Douglas MacDonald and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Animated version of the popular children’s story by Robert Munsch is about a young boy with a major problem: his apartment has become a subway station but his mother doesn’t believe him and blames him for the commuters’ mess. Jonathan takes his problem to City Hall and gets his first look at what bureaucratic bungling is all about. Munsch’s story is entitled Jonathan Cleaned Up—Then He Heard a Sound. Music by Alex Pauk. Voice and narration by Hannah Goodheart.

results.title: Blackbeard the pirate
results.creator_credit: Raoul Walsh, Edmund Grainger and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: Shot in Technicolour, this rousing swashbuckler set in the 17th century tells the story of Blackbeard who, while pillaging the high seas kidnaps the adopted daughter of Sir Henry Morgan, a high official in Jamaica, much to the dismay of her lover, an officer in the British navy. Swordplay and derring-do abound as the timid officer must fight to win back his love, even as Blackbeard duels with his arch-enemy Morgan, who is also a reformed pirate.

results.title: Blackbeard's ghost
results.creator_credit: Robert Stevenson and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: The legendary pirate Blackbeard is cursed to wander in limbo until he performs a good deed. He gets his chance when he decides to help a local college track team that hasn’t a ghost of a chance of winning! Cast includes Peter Ustinov, Dean Jones, Suzanne Pleshette, Elsa Lanchester. Based on the book by Ben Stahl.

results.title: Blade runner [Director's cut]
results.creator_credit: Ridley Scott, Michael Deeley, Bud Yorkin, Jerry Perenchio, Sir Run Run Shaw and Ladd Company
results.brief_description: Ridley Scott’s adaptation of Philip K. Dick’s novel “Do androids dream of electric sheep” has rapidly become a classic of the science fiction genre. In Los Angeles, 2019, Deckard, a licensed-to-kill cop is given the task of tracking down and destroying a group of intelligent androids who have hijacked a space shuttle and returned to Earth. In the process Deckard has to confront disturbing questions about what makes a human being. “A richly detailed and visually overwhelming trip to the future which sticks with you like a recurrent nightmare.” Starring Harrison Ford, Rutger Hauer and Sean Young.

results.title: Blade II
results.creator_credit: Guillermo del Toro, Patrick Palmer, Wesley Snipes, Peter Frankfurt and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: Based on Marvel Comics more dark super hero franchise, “Blade II” chronicles the adventures of a half human, half vampire (Wesley Snipes) who diligently protects humans from the seething vampire underworld. Mexican horror director Guillermo del Toro (The Devil’s backbone, Cronos) has fashioned a faithful sequel which delves deeper into the vampire mythology set up in the first film while maintaining the series penchant for blood soaked martial arts action. Set in Prague (its gothic buildings and ancient cobblestoned streets make this a fitting location for a vampire movie), “Blade II“‘s action takes off when a new breed of vampires are discovered, the Deadly Reapers. These nasty nightcrawlers not only feed on humans but are not impartial to vampire blood as well. This causes the worried vampire fraternity (known as the Shadow Council) to form an uneasy alliance with arch-enemy Blade and his gruff side-kick Whistler (Kris Kristofferson). Together they must hunt down and destroy the rapidly spreading reapers before they eliminate all the vampires and take over the human race. Cast includes: Luke Goss, Ron Perlman, Leonor Varela, Norman Reedus.

results.title: Blackboards
results.creator_credit: Samira Makhmalbaf, Marco Muller, Mohsen Makhmalbaf, Fabrica and Mosfilm
results.brief_description: Set on the border of Iran and Iraq during the terrible war of the 1980s, “Blackboards” follows a group of poor teachers, blackboards strapped to their backs, as they attempt to educate the young Kurdish children who are some of the primary victims of war. But the young children who they see, largely orphaned and living in extreme poverty and hardship, are too busy working as smugglers to be convinced about the worth of education. Filmed in the rugged mountainous terrain of Kurdistan, “Blackboards” uses the most economic means of mise-en-scene and editing to create a powerful evocation of the terror of war. The bonds between men and women - marriage, family - and the sanctity of childhood are all shown as precarious in a context where chemical bombs and machine guns can destroy a whole community. As the teachers join the increasing load of refugees fleeing across the wild savage borders, we are confronted with one of cinema’s most moving expressions of the madness and evil of war. Samira Makhmalbaf, who was only twenty one when she directed this film, won the Grand Prix at Cannes, the youngest director ever to win the award. The cast of the film are largely non-professional and consist of Kurdish refugees who at the time of writing this catalogue entry (2001) still do not have a homeland of their own.

results.title: Black Tuesday
results.brief_description: A report on the disastrous bushfires on the outskirts of Hobart on the 7th of February, 1967. Shows scenes during the fires, the damage caused, and interviews with people involved. The temporary housing and rehabilitation of homeless fire victims is described.
results.description: A report on the disastrous bushfires on the outskirts of Hobart on the 7th of February, 1967. Shows scenes during the fires, the damage caused, and interviews with people involved. The temporary housing and rehabilitation of homeless fire victims is described.

results.title: Black Samson
results.creator_credit: Charles Bail, Daniel B. Cady, Omni Pictures and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: One of the more conscientious and political ‘right on’ of the Blaxploitation genre, Charles Bail’s (‘Cleopatra Jones and the Casino of gold’) ‘Black Samson’ stars Rockne Tarkington as Samson, a community minded nightclub owner whose softly spoken voice and peaceful demure doesn’t deter him from sticking it to the ‘man’ when drugs invade his inner city neighbourhood. His saintly like persona is further enhanced by the staff he carries with him everywhere, which also happens to be a deadly weapon when needed. Samson’s patience is tested when the mafia begin to recruit some of the black gangs in his hood to help them distribute drugs in the area. Things get personal however when the mob rough-up his girlfriend in order to dissuade him from interfering with their racket. Naturally all hell breaks loose as Samson bands with his neighbourhood to combat the drug menace and settle his personal score. Cast also includes William Smith, Connie Strickland, Michael Payne and Carol Speed.
